member.name: E:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.SaveRule
member.summary: Code Effects raises this event when the user clicks the Save button on the Tool Bar. Ignored by Code Effects if ShowToolBar is set to False

member.name: E:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.DeleteRule
member.summary: Code Effects raises this event when the user clicks the Delete button on the Tool Bar. Ignored by Code Effects if ShowToolBar is set to False

member.name: E:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.LoadRule
member.summary: Code Effects raises this event when the user selects a rule from the Rules menu on the Tool Bar. Ignored by Code Effects if ShowToolBar is set to False

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.ToolBarRules
member.summary: Gets or sets collection of rules that appear in the Rules menu of the Tool Bar. This collection can contain rules of all types. This property is ignored if ShowToolBar is set to False.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.ContextMenuRules
member.summary: Gets or sets collection of rules that appear in context menus of Code Effects. This collection can contain only rules of evaluation type (this requirement is not enforced by Code Effects).

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the submitted rule is empty

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.IsValid
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the submitted rule is valid

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.DataSources
member.summary: Gets or sets collection of named Dynamic Menu Data Source delegates.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.GetRuleDelegate
member.summary: Gets or sets a method delegate that returns rule XML by rule's ID. Set this property if you store each rule in a separate XML document. It can be used by LoadRuleXml, LoadRuleFile and ToString() overload to look up rules by their IDs if you store each rule in a separate document. It can be used by rule validation process to check for circular references in the current rule as well. See the Reusable Rules documentation topic for details.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.HelpXml
member.summary: Gets or sets the XML document of the custom help XML. HelpXml property allows you to specify a Help XML that contains different values for Help String messages, Tool Bar labels and rule validation error messages. This could be helpful for multilingual applications.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.ExcludedOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets collection of operators that Code Effects should exclude from using on the client

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.SourceXml
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of XML document of source object used by this instance of RuleEditor. Use the GetSourceXml() method to obtain XML document of the current source if you intend to manually alter source object's XML.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of source object used by this instance of RuleEditor.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.SourceXmlFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the full path of custom XML file that this instance of RuleEditor should use as its source object. Use the GetSourceXml() method to obtain XML document of the current source if you intend to manually alter source object's XML.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.SourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type name of the source object. Use typeof(YourSource).FullName to obtain this value

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.SourceAssembly
member.summary: Gets or sets the qualified name of the assembly that declares the source object.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.CacheSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the source object's data should be cached by the server. The default value is False.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.ClientOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles Code Effects' UI "client-only" mode. The default value is False.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.ShowLineDots
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles "dots" at the beginning of each new line in the Rule Area. The default value is False.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.ShowMenuOnRightArrowKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles the visibility of the context menu when user uses keyboard's "right arrow" key to navigate the rule. The default value is True.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.ShowMenuOnElementClicked
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles the visibility of the context menu containing related items when user clicks a rule element. The default value is True.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.ShowDescriptionsOnMouseHover
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles the visibility of description of rule fields, in-rule methods, actions and nested rules for those elements that have their descriptions set. The default value is True.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.RuleNameIsRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether Code Effects should require each rule to have a name. This property is ignored if ShowToolBar is set to False. The default value is True.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.ShowToolBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles the visibility of Tool Bar. The default value is False if Mode property is set to CodeEffects.Rule.Common.RuleType.Filter and True for all other modes.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.KeepDeclaredOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether Code Effects should alphabetically order fields and actions in menus or keep the order in which they are declared in the source object. The default value is False.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that defines what type of rules users can create. Value of RuleType.Evaluation limits Code Effects UI to evaluation type rules only. Value of RuleType.Execution permits both execution and evaluation types. The default value is CodeEffects.Rule.Common.RuleType.Evaluation.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.Theme
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of Code Effects UI theme. Set this property to ThemeType.None if you intend to use your own styles. The default value is CodeEffects.Rule.Common.ThemeType.Gray.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.HelpXmlFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the full path to the custom help XML file. HelpXmlFile property allows you to specify a Help XML that contains different values for Help String messages, Tool Bar labels and rule valiadation error messages. This could be helpful for multilingual applications.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.ShowHelpString
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles the visibility of Help String. The default value is True.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Asp.RuleEditor.CacheHelp
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether Help XML should be cached by the server. The default value is False.

member.name: T:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute
member.summary: Allows customization of rule field

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Empty public c-tor

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.ValueInputType
member.summary: Gets or sets the input type that user can use to set the value of this field

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the label that will be used in UI to represent this field. Default value is the name of this field.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.CollectionItemName
member.summary: Gets or sets the singular label for IEnumerable<T> property or field. For example, for collection List<Order> named Orders this value could be set to Order. Setting this value helps to display collection fields in a human-like language in cetain menus and other UI elements. Ingnored for fields of non-generic collections and non-collection types. Default value is the value of the DisplayName property.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.CollectionItemType
member.summary: Gets or sets the item type of non-generic IEnumerable collection property. Ingnored for IEnumerable<T> collections and non-collection properties. The non-generic IEnumerable property is ignored by Code Effects control if this value is not set.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of this field. Users can view this description by hovering the mouse over the field in the Rule Editor.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.Min
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value that user can input for this field. Used by numeric types only; ignored by all other types

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.Max
member.summary: For numeric types, gets or sets the maximum value that user can input for this field. For string types, gets the maximum length of the string that user can input for this field. Ignored by all other types.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: For date and time types, gets or sets the .NET DateTime format string that is used by Code Effects control to display the value of this field in UI. Rule evaluation does not depend on this property.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.AllowCalculations
member.summary: For numeric types, gets or sets the value indicating whether this field allows user to enter calculations as its value. Ignored by all other types.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.IncludeInCalculations
member.summary: For numeric types, gets or sets the value indicating whether this field can be included in value calculations of other fields. Ignored by all other types.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.StringComparison
member.summary: For string types, gets or sets the string comparison type for this field. The default value is StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase. Ignored by all other types.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.DataSourceName
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the unique name of Dynamic Menu Data Source. See Code Effects control online documentation for details.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.Gettable
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the value of this field appears in UI context menus that list available rule fields and in-rule methods for rule conditions. The default value is True

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.FieldAttribute.Settable
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the value of this field can be set in execution type rules. The default value is False for const or readonly fields and properties that have a private setter. It's True for all other fields and properties.

member.summary: Gets or sets the description of this parameter. Users can view this description by hovering the mouse over the parameter in the Rule Editor.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.ParameterAttribute.CollectionItemType
member.summary: Gets or sets the item type of the non-generic IEnumerable parameter. Ingnored for IEnumerable<T> collections and non-collection types. The entire method is ignored by Code Effects control if the value of this property is not set for any of the non-generic IEnumerable parameter of the method.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.ParameterAttribute.Min
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value that user can input for this parameter. Used by numeric types only; ignored by all other types.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.ParameterAttribute.Max
member.summary: For numeric types, gets or sets the maximum value that user can input for this parameter. For string types, gets the maximum length of the string that user can input for this parameter. Ignored by all other types.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.ParameterAttribute.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: For date and time types, gets or sets the .NET DateTime format string that is used by Code Effects control to display the value of this parameter in UI. Rule evaluation does not depend on this property.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Attributes.ParameterAttribute.ConstantValue
member.summary: Get or sets a constant value for this parameter. If this value is set, this parameter will be hidden from users. This constant value is used by rule evaluation.

member.summary: Provides rule evaluation functionality

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.Evaluator.#ctor(System.Type,System.String,CodeEffects.Rule.Core.GetRuleDelegate,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Evaluator to a specified set of rules. A delegate of type GetRuleDelegate is used to request any rule that may be referenced inside another rule.
member.param: The XML containing one or more rules to be evaluated against objects. The XML ruleset must validate against http://codeeffects.com/schemas/rule/4 schema.

The delegate to a method used to retrieve external rules (rules referenced by other rules). If this parameter is null, the Evaluator will attempt to find any referenced rules inside the ruleset. If none are found an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.Evaluator.#ctor(System.Type,System.String,CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Evaluator to a specified set of rules. A delegate of type GetRuleDelegate is used to request any rule that may be referenced inside another rule.
member.param: The XML containing one or more rules to be evaluated against objects. The XML ruleset must validate against http://codeeffects.com/schemas/rule/4 schema.
A set of parameters that determine various aspects of rule compilation and evaluation. See for more information

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.Evaluator.CompileRule(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Builds an expression tree that represents the given rule. The expression tree is then cached and compiled into byte code.
member.param: A rule to be compiled.

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.Evaluator.Evaluate(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Executes (evaluates) the rule against the source object. If no id is provided, the first rule of the ruleset will be used.
member.param: The object which needs to be evaluated. It acts as a source of data for the rule.

An optional id of a rule. If there are more than one rule in the ruleset, you may evaluate a specific rule by providing its id. Not to be confused with external rules referenced inside other rules. This rule must be present as a top level rule inside the ruleset or an exception will be thrown.
member.returns: Returns boolean result of evaluation: true if successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.Evaluator.Evaluate(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes (evaluates) the specific rule against the source object.
member.param: The object which needs to be evaluated. It acts as a source of data for the rule.

An index of a rule to be executed. If there are more than one rule in the ruleset, you may evaluate a specific rule by providing its index. Not to be confused with external rules referenced inside other rules. This rule must be present as a top level rule inside the ruleset or exception wil be thrown.
member.returns: Returns boolean result of evaluation: true if successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.Evaluator.Evaluate(System.Object,CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationScope,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes (evaluates) all rules in a ruleset based on scope against the source object.
member.param: The object which needs to be evaluated. It acts as a source of data for the rule.
Scope determines a logical operator (AND, OR) to be used when executing rules.
Short-circuting tells evaluator to stop as soon as scope is satisfied. If false, the evaluator will continue executing all rules even if answer is already known. Default is true.
member.returns: Returns boolean result of evaluation: true if successful, false otherwise.

member.name: T:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.Evaluator`1

summary.para: Compiles and executes business rules against source objects.

One or more rules may be combined into one single XML string. If a rule contains references to other external rules, the Evaluator will try to locate them among rules in the given XML or call a delegate, if one is provided. Rules then are compiled and stored in memory for future execution by Evaluate methods.

member.remarks: See http://codeeffects.com/schemas/rule/3 schema for information on full ruleset format.
member.typeparam: The type of a source object against which rules are evaluated.

member.param: The XML containing one or more rules to be evaluated against objects. The XML ruleset must validate against http://codeeffects.com/schemas/rule/4 schema.

The delegate to a method used to retrieve external rules (rules referenced by other rules). If this parameter is null, the Evaluator will attempt to find any referenced rules inside the ruleset. If none are found an exception will be thrown.

summary.para: Provides functionality for rule evaluation based on its type. During compilation a rule engine needs to know the type of the source object so that it can be loaded and analyzed using reflection.
This evaluator attempts to determine the type of the object dynamically and place it in the cache.
This is used when rules for different source types are stored in the same ruleset.

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.ExpressionBuilderBase.Build(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: A body of the rule used to be a method, a condition, an "or", an "and", or any other single element, so long it evaluates to a boolean. Now it also may be multiple "if" elements. When the EvaluationScope property is All, "if" statements are wrapped in the "AND", otherwise the "OR". If the ShortCircuit is false, all "if" stements will be evaluated even if the answer is already known.
member.param: A collection of a single valid statement or multiple 'if' statements
member.returns: An expression tree representing the rule

member.name: T:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.RuleExtensions
member.summary: Provides a set of static methods for evaluating business rules against individual objects and for filtering objects that implement one of the following: , , , . These methods use either or class internally to apply business rules.

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.RuleExtensions.Filter(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Type,System.String,System.String,CodeEffects.Rule.Core.GetRuleDelegate)
member.summary: Filters the collection of source objects by applying a business rule. The rulesetXml is loaded into and its rules are compiled and stored in memory. Then either the first rule in the ruleset or the one referenced by the rule id is evaluated against each object in the collection. Those source objects that pass the rule are returned as a new collection of type .
member.param: An enumerable collection of type that needs to be filtered.
An underlying source type of an enumerable collection.
The XML containing one or more rules to be evaluated against source objects. The XML ruleset must validate against http://codeeffects.com/schemas/rule/4 schema.

An optional id of a rule. If there are more than one rule in the ruleset, you may evaluate a specific rule by providing its id. Not to be confused with external reusable rules referenced in rules inside of the rulesetXml. The rule with this id must be present as a top level rule inside the rulesetXml or exception will be thrown.

The delegate to a method used to retrieve external rules by id (reusable rules referenced by other rules). If this parameter is null, the Evaluator will attempt to find any referenced rules inside the rulesetXml. If none are found an exception will be thrown.
member.returns: Returns a new collection of source objects that passed the rule evaluation.

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.RuleExtensions.Filter(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Type,System.String,CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters)
member.summary: Filters a collection of source objects by applying a business rule. The rulesetXml is loaded into and its rules are compiled into expression trees. This method does not evaluate immediately. Instead it returns an expression tree which can be further modified. During immediate evaluation, the expression tree is translated into a set of backend commands supported by its LINQ provider. In case of LINQ-to-SQL, the expression tree is translated into a set of SQL commands.
member.param: A queryable collection of type that needs to be filtered.
An underlying source type of a queryable collection.
The XML containing one or more rules to be evaluated against source objects. The XML ruleset must validate against http://codeeffects.com/schemas/rule/4 schema.
An set of various parameters that determine how to build and evalute the rule. See for more information.
member.returns: Returns an expression tree for deferred or immediate evaluation. Immediate evaluation is handled by a LINQ provider.

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.RuleExtensions.Evaluate``1(``0,System.String,System.String,CodeEffects.Rule.Core.GetRuleDelegate)
member.summary: Evaluates a rule from the ruleset against given source object. This extension method is just a shortcut for calling method. Use directly if you plan on executing multiple Evaluate calls with the same set of rules. The rule evaluator compiles rules once per instantiating.
member.typeparam: An underlying source type of an object that will have rules evaluated against.
member.param: An object that needs to be evaluated against a rule.
A set of rules. If no rule id is provided, the first rule in the set will be executed.
An id of a rule to be executed.

The delegate to a method used to retrieve external rules (rules referenced by other rules). If this parameter is null, the Evaluator will attempt to find any referenced rules inside the ruleset. If none are found an exception will be thrown.
member.returns: True if rule evaluated successfully, False otherwise.

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.RuleExtensions.Evaluate``1(``0,System.String,System.Int32,CodeEffects.Rule.Core.GetRuleDelegate)
member.summary: Evaluates a rule from the ruleset against given source object. This extension method is just a shortcut for calling method. Use directly if you plan on executing multiple Evaluate calls with the same set of rules. The rule evaluator compiles rules once per instantiating.
member.typeparam: An underlying source type of an object that will have rules evaluated against.
member.param: An object that needs to be evaluated against a rule.
A set of rules. The rule at the provided index will be executed.
An index of a rule to be executed.

The delegate to a method used to retrieve external rules (rules referenced by other rules). If this parameter is null, the Evaluator will attempt to find any referenced rules inside the ruleset. If none are found an exception will be thrown.
member.returns: True if rule evaluated successfully, False otherwise.

member.name: M:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.RuleExtensions.GetProviderType(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: This is a hack. It tries to determine whether given source has LINQ-to-SQL provider. It relies on the fact LINQ-to-SQL designer uses the DataQuery class which has hidden field "context" of type DataContext. This issue arises due to the fact that when filtering a LINQ-to-SQL generated collections, the source is of type DataQuery, which is an internal Microsoft class and there is no other way to verify the actual provider.
member.param: An enumerable collection of type for which a provider needs to be determined.

member.name: T:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.LinqProviderType
member.summary: Specifies how to handle various LINQ providers when building expression trees. The Default means that the engine will try to identify a type of a LINQ provider automatically. SQL is for LINQ-to-SQL providers and Entities is for LINQ-to-Entities. The reason why this enum exists is because various providers handle string operation differently and most of the time it is impossible to auto-determine the behavior of the current provider.

member.name: T:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.ConversionVisitor
member.summary: A helper class. It replaces IndexOf expressions with Contains so that Linq-to-SQL can convert them to the LIKE statement.

member.name: T:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters
member.summary: A set of parameters that determine how engine handles the expression builds and rule evaluations.

member.name: F:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters.RuleId
member.summary: Id of the rule to be evaluated or compiled.

member.name: F:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters.RuleGetter
member.summary: A delegate for requesting missing rules (rules that are being referenced but not included in the ruleset).

member.name: F:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters.LINQProviderType
member.summary: A type of LINQ provider. Right now only three providers are supported: LINQ-to-Object, LINQ-to-SQL, and LINQ-to-Entities. Other providers may work as well as long as they implement the same sub-set of commands as LINQ-to-SQL. Use the Default value for all other providers.

member.name: F:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters.PerformNullChecks
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the engine builds null-pointer safety checks into compiled code to avoid run-time exceptions.

member.name: F:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters.MaxIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the maximum number of iterations before evaluation fails in the Loop mode. The value of -1 sets no limits. The default value is -1.

member.name: F:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that specifies how to treat multiple rules in a ruleset when they are evaluated in one step using the Ruleset mode. The default value is EvaluationScope.All.

member.name: F:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters.ShortCircuit
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether to stop further evaluation of a rule immediatelly after the result is determined. The default value is True.

member.name: F:CodeEffects.Rule.Core.EvaluationParameters.Precision
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of fractional digits to round decimal or double values to. ounding is done only in comparison operators using the Math.Round() method. The default value is -1, no rounding.

member.summary: Gets or sets the full path to the custom help XML file. HelpXmlFile property allows you to specify a Help XML that contains different values for Help String messages, Tool Bar labels and rule validation error messages. This could be helpful for multilingual applications.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Mvc.RuleEditor.ShowHelpString
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles the visibility of Help String. The default value is True.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Mvc.RuleEditor.ShowLineDots
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles "dots" at the beginning of each new line in the Rule Area. The default value is False.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Mvc.RuleEditor.ShowMenuOnRightArrowKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles the visibility of the context menu when user uses keyboard's "right arrow" key to navigate the rule. The default value is True.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Mvc.RuleEditor.ShowMenuOnElementClicked
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles the visibility of the context menu when user clicks a rule element. The default value is True.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Mvc.RuleEditor.ShowDescriptionsOnMouseHover
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles the visibility of description of rule fields, in-rule methods, actions and nested rules for those elements that have their descriptions set. The default value is True.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Mvc.RuleEditor.ShowToolBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that toggles the visibility of Tool Bar. The default value is False if Mode property is set to CodeEffects.Rule.Common.RuleType.Filter and True for all other modes.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Mvc.RuleEditor.KeepDeclaredOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether Code Effects component should alphabetically order fields and actions in menus or keep the order in which they are declared in the source object. The default value is False.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Mvc.RuleEditor.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that defines what type of rules users can create. Value of RuleType.Evaluation limits Code Effects UI to evaluation type rules only. Value of RuleType.Execution permits both execution and evaluation types. The default value is CodeEffects.Rule.Common.RuleType.Evaluation.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Mvc.RuleEditor.Theme
member.summary: This property is not intended for public use. Use the StyleManager class instead.

member.summary: Gets or sets collection of rules that appear in the Rules menu of the Tool Bar. This collection can contain rules of all types. This property is ignored if ShowToolBar is set to False.

member.name: P:CodeEffects.Rule.Mvc.RuleEditor.ContextMenuRules
member.summary: Gets or sets collection of rules that appear in context menus of Code Effects component. This collection can contain only rules of evaluation type (this requirement is not enforced by Code Effects component).
